reviewText: At first I thought the footwork would be a challenge (since I'm not the most graceful or coordinated!), but I found the steps to be easy to catch on to. And once I got moving, I was working up a sweat and having fun! And Gilad is such an encouraging and entertaining trainer! This workout provides cardio, strength and toning, and core training- a great mix, a great overall workout! Highly recommended!
summary: A great overall workout! Have fun!

reviewText: Good to see a landscape to work out to that's a little different than the norm.  Nice DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Like many people, I do a lot of dvd excercise, and Ive always found gilad a favourite, not only because hes knowledgeable and easy to follow, but mainly because hes fun, one finds oneself choosing his dvds because theyre never a chore, his attitude is so positive.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I started my habit of working out about 18 years ago, when I was about 13...with Gilad.  Then over the years, did other stuff.  I have recently been searching for a good workout dvd.  While the new ones of today make me feel good and fit no doubt, they have added unwanted bulk on my legs. (that I hate) So I decided to go back to the good old tried and true aerobics.  This dvd is so much fun.  I can't remember the last time I had so much fun working out.  It doesn't feel like a chore.  And as for the cheesiness, thats Gilad.  He's so cool he can be cheesy.  And some of the moves are older moves but I don't care what it takes, I am not trying to impress anyone with my workout, I just want a good end result. This is an excellent dvd. I also like the music on this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have all of Gilad's classic collection. Some dvd's he will focus on one workout far more than the other ones, such as a long high impact aerobic segment and a weak abs segment. I usually like the long ones since I get a full body workout. This one seems a bit rushed for some reason, the aerobics is so rushed he had to keep getting onto his mom about catching up. He short changes you on the floorwork especially the thighs. I have to say the abs is one of the best routines he has out there today, its very long and intense, no breaks. The cool down was about thirty seconds the shortest I have ever seen Gilad do. All in all the ab routine is worth the purchase. The best classic dvd and frankly the best dvd he has out there is the 45/45 split routine.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Although not as tasking as Gilad's step DVD, this is an exuberant, bracing and beautiful exercise session. Jerusalem is part of the beauty, of course, but the energetic, rhythmic and live music, played by an Israeli group, impels you to get off the couch (as Gilad says) and dance!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is several different workouts from the Bodies In Motion TV show. I was hoping the workout would not be from his shows. The good thing about the DVD is there are no commercials. You do alternate from low impact to high impact aerobics which helps get your heart rate up.Overall, it was a good workout. Nothing new.
